so_63393883: while read ;
do 
rep=s( echo $REPLY | sed 's/.\/dir3//' ) #bad method but more readable
mkdir -p new/$rep && cp $REPLY new/$rep/
done < filesource

nl2bash_9582: Print mv commands to rename all files under current directory by formatting the filenames with the sed scripts '\''s/^([^-]*)-\s*([^\.]*)/\L\1\E-\2/'\'', '\''s/ /_/g'\'' and '\''s/_-/-/g'\''
Top-3 Scripts:
so_60016712: find test -type f -mtime -1 -exec bash -c '
    src=("$@")
    dst=("${@/#test/backup}")
    mkdir -p "${dst[@]%/*}"
    for i in "${!src[@]}"; do
        cp "${src[i]}" "${dst[i]}"
    done
' _ {} +

Explanations about Options.-name:
This option is supported, but POSIX conformance depends on the POSIX conformance of
 the system's fnmatch(3) library function. As of findutils-4.2.2, shell
 metacharacters (`*', `?' or `[]' for example) will match a leading `.', because
 IEEE PASC interpretation 126 requires this. This is a change from previous
 versions of findutils.
